snippet: After a recent assertion by the Israeli prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, that he would never agree to a Palestinian state, the Palestinians can argue that they no longer have a negotiating partner.
abstract: Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu's admission that he will never agree to Palestinian state may serve to validate Palestine's unilateral approach to gaining statehood, allowing for argument that Israel is not willing partner in peace process

byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta contributed reporting from the United Nations, and Steven Erlanger from London.

lead_paragraph: After a recent assertion by the Israeli prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, that he would never agree to a Palestinian state, the Palestinians can argue that they no longer have a negotiating partner.

headline.main: Palestinian Leaders See Validation of Their Statehood Effort
headline.print_headline: Palestinian Leaders See Validation of Their Statehood Effort
